Moon Calculations

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orbit_of_the_Moon For the moment the following things are being assumed for these calculations;

  • playable areas exist at equator.
  • Moons have equatorial orbit with 0 declination
  • Moons are tidal locked (rotation = period of orbit)

Most of these items will be removed over time.

Phase

portion of a moon that is illuminated conforms to (-.5cos((2/g)PIx)+.5)*100% where g is the period of the moon and x is the amount of time since the calculation was initiated. ergo, if the calculator used game days g = 6 for Koris and 42 for Phanri, while x would be measured in game days. For a more accurate phase shift (for Koris) and to integrate with location calculations, g = 1440 for Koris and 10080 for Phanri and x would be measured in real minutes.

Also of note; direction of illumination for the moon switches when this equasion = 1 or 0.

Position

Ignoring planetary axial tilt and the angle of a moon's orbit (assuming it's simply orbiting at the equator, and not on the eclyptic or and degree of offset from that)- a moon's position in the night sky will traverse a simple arc.

A moon's rise time progresses (duration of day in minutes)/(days in lunar cycle). Ergo Phanri (with a day lingth of 240 minutes and lunar cycle of 42 days) rises approx 5.714 minutes later each day. With the exception of ultra-fast moons, such as Koris which have multi-phase nights, this starts at sunrise when it is new and moves from there.

Again, excepting ultra-fast moons, the moon remains visible for approximately 1/2 the "day" (time from midnight to midnight). As a rule of thumb, the appearance duration of a moon should be shortened by 1/4 the progression rate. Ergo Phanri would appear for about 118.5714 minutes per day while Koris would appear for about 110 minutes per day.

planetary axial tilt

Axial tilt impacts the north/south movement of the celestial bodies above the planet.

Sun

At the equator the sun is directly above on the equanoxes. Regardless of location, it reaches each extrema of the north-south movement at the solstices. As an individual moves towards a pole, the central orbit of the sun moves an equal number of degrees towards the opposite horizon. The sun shifts (degrees of axial tilt)/(days of the year).

Moons

The moon's north-south drift is determined by it's angle from the eclyptic plain, and seasonal phase.

Purple moon?

While it was initially chose to highlight the fantastic and stand out, there are several scientifically valid reasons it could exist.

There are at least a couple explanations for a purple color to a celestial body.

  • An abundance of SiO2 and Fe2O3 (roughly the chemical composition of Amathyst).
  • Proper chemical composition of an atmosphere around the body would refract light to highlight itself as purple.
